citations.narrative:
The licensee has moved without notifying the Animal Welfare Operation Office of a change in address. There is a real
estate for sale sign in the lawn, there is no equipment in the machine shop, and the dog kennel has been disassembled.
Licenses are issued to specific persons, and are issued for specific activities, types and numbers of animals, and
approved sites. A new license must be obtained upon change of ownership, location, activities, or animals. A licensee
shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 days and obtain a new license before any change in the name, address,
management, substantial control or ownership of his business or operation, locations, activities, and number or type of
animals described in paragraph (b)(2) of this section.
Licensee must notify the office of any change in address where animals are located no fewer than 90 before the change.
To be corrected from this day forward, March 20, 2024

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS officials during the inspection process at 8:30 AM on
28FEB2024.
The inspector knocked on the door and called the cell phone. The voice mailbox was full so no message could be left.
The licensee failed to have a responsible person available to conduct an animal welfare inspection. The facility was not
able to be inspected for compliance with the Animal Welfare Act, regulations and standards to ensure the health and well-
being of the animals.
A responsible person must be made available to accompany the inspector on an animal welfare inspection.
End Section

narrative:
2.1(b)(1) 
   
Requirements and application 
The licensee has moved without notifying the Animal Welfare Operation Office of a change in address. There is a real 
estate for sale sign in the lawn, there is no equipment in the machine shop, and the dog kennel has been disassembled. 
Licenses are issued to specific persons, and are issued for specific activities, types and numbers of animals, and 
approved sites. A new license must be obtained upon change of ownership, location, activities, or animals. A licensee 
shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 days and obtain a new license before any change in the name, address, 
management, substantial control or ownership of his business or operation, locations, activities, and number or type of 
animals described in paragraph (b)(2) of this section. 
Licensee must notify the office of any change in address where animals are located no fewer than 90 before the change. 
To be corrected from this day forward, March 20, 2024 
2.126(b) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS officials during the inspection process at 8:30 AM on 
28FEB2024. 
The inspector knocked on the door and called the cell phone. The voice mailbox was full so no message could be left. 
The licensee failed to have a responsible person available to conduct an animal welfare inspection. The facility was not 
able to be inspected for compliance with the Animal Welfare Act, regulations and standards to ensure the health and well-
being of the animals. 
A responsible person must be made available to accompany the inspector on an animal welfare inspection. 
 
 
End Section
